design_audit.model_formula: pvlifeincd05 ~ male + m_s13 + m_s14 + m_s15 + m_s16 + m_parented + m_black + m_latino + m_regionnc + m_regionso + m_regionwe + m_urban14 + m_gpahs + m_afqt89 + m_gpahs_afqt89 + m_gpahs_parented + m_afqt89_parented + female + f_s13 + f_s14 + f_s15 + f_s16 + f_parented + f_black + f_latino + f_regionnc + f_regionso + f_regionwe + f_urban14 + f_gpahs + f_afqt89 + f_gpahs_afqt89 + f_gpahs_parented + f_afqt89_parented, robust, noconstant
design_audit.selection_story: Reduced-form Mincer-style lifetime income regression using NLSY79 cohort. Present value of lifetime income (5% discount rate) is regressed on years of continuous schooling dummies, demographics, and ability measures. Coefficients for schooling dummies capture returns to education conditional on ability and demographics. Gender-fully-interacted model estimated on HS graduates in NLSY79 longitudinal sample.

claim_object.outcome_concept: Present value of lifetime income at 5% discount rate (thousands of 1992 dollars)
claim_object.treatment_concept: Years of continuous post-secondary education (s13=1yr, s14=2yr, s15=3yr, s16=4+yr vs s12=HS only)
claim_object.estimand_concept: Returns to continuous post-secondary enrollment on lifetime income, conditional on ability, demographics, and parental background. Key parameter: coefficient on m_s16 (male 4-year college premium)
claim_object.target_population: NLSY79 respondents who are high school graduates, with complete income records from age 19-62 (with interpolation)

constraints.notes: The paper uses this regression to project lifetime income onto NELS sample for structural estimation. Gender-fully-interacted no-constant specification. Alternative specs vary: discount rate (5% vs 10%), sample restrictions, heterogeneous returns by ability/GPA/parent education, wage-based vs income-based DV.

canonical.notes: Robust (HC1) standard errors as in original paper (Stata robust option)
